ca.mcgill.ecse211.project

Class LightLocalization

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.project.LightLocalization

  • public class LightLocalization
extends java.lang.Object
    This class will provide methods to perform odometer correction using light sensors which are sampled by the LightSensorPoller thread. In order to correct the position of the robot, this class will provide methods to localize at different waypoints using two light sensors. The odoCorrectionFirst method corrects the robot's position along the y-axis. The odoCorrectionSecond method corrects the robot's position along the x-axis.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      LightLocalization()
      Creates a LightLocalization object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void initialLocalizationUsingLS()
      Initial LS localization to (1,1) after US localization.
      void odoCorrectionFirst()
      Corrects the EV3 along the the axis the robot is closest too.
      void odoCorrectionSecond()
      Corrects the EV3 along the the second axis.
      void singleLineCorrection(double turnBy)
      Light sensor correction along a single line used before and after the tunnel to ensure straight line travel through said tunnel.
      void updateOdometer()
      This method updates the odometer coordinates to those of the point that the odoCorrection just localized to.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LightLocalization

        public LightLocalization()
        Creates a LightLocalization object.

    • Method Detail

      • initialLocalizationUsingLS

        public void initialLocalizationUsingLS()
        Initial LS localization to (1,1) after US localization.

      • singleLineCorrection

        public void singleLineCorrection(double turnBy)
        Light sensor correction along a single line used before and after the tunnel to ensure straight line travel through said tunnel. Uses static methods from NavigatorUtility class.
        Parameters:
        turnBy - initial angle to turn by to align axle along the line we use to correct with

      • odoCorrectionFirst

        public void odoCorrectionFirst()
        Corrects the EV3 along the the axis the robot is closest too. This is the first part of the light correction of the odometer. The robot drives backwards until one or both of the light sensors cross a line, from this it aligns itself along the line and turns 90 degrees clockwise.

      • odoCorrectionSecond

        public void odoCorrectionSecond()
        Corrects the EV3 along the the second axis. This is the second part of the light correction of the odometer. The robot drives backwards until one or both of the light sensors cross a line, from this it aligns itself along the line. The robot now sits centered above a point on the grid.

      • updateOdometer

        public void updateOdometer()
        This method updates the odometer coordinates to those of the point that the odoCorrection just localized to. It sets them to the point to which the robot thinks it is currently closest to.
